meanings.definition: A unit of currency in El Salvador, equal to 100 centavos.
meanings.sent1: In El Salvador, you can buy many things with a colone.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for colones when I visited El Salvador.
meanings.sent3: The colone in my pocket felt like a treasure from a distant land.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a thousand colones.
meanings.sent5: The shiny colone sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: A colonist or inhabitant of a colony.
meanings.sent1: The colone helped build a new home in the colony.
meanings.sent2: The colone was proud to be part of the growing colony.
meanings.sent3: The colone's favorite pastime was exploring the colony's surroundings.
meanings.sent4: She was a true colone, dedicated to the success of the colony.
meanings.sent5: Every colone played a vital role in the colony's development.

meanings.definition: A punctuation mark (:) used to introduce a list or explanation.
meanings.sent1: Remember to use a colone before listing your favorite colors: red, blue, and green.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked us to add a colone after the heading.
meanings.sent3: The colone on the page seemed to wink at me mischievously.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a colone, guiding us through the complex instructions.
meanings.sent5: The colone stood out on the page, drawing attention to the important information.
